noun.description: A flexible strap or belt used in the form of a loop to support or raise a weight.
examples: the horse had to be supported by a sling fixed to the roof

noun.description: A simple weapon in the form of a strap or loop, used to hurl stones or other small missiles.

verb.description: Suspend or arrange (something), especially with a strap or straps, so that it hangs loosely in a particular position.
examples: a hammock was slung between two trees

verb.description: Throw; fling (often used to express the speaker's casual attitude)
examples: sling a few things into your knapsack

phrases: I still wait tables and sling hash for a living and I'm loving it!
At a counter you'll find independent folks who enjoy being close to slinging hash, feeling the heat of the grill, and watching the transformation of ingredients from raw state to dinner plate.
They said, Sure - provided she sling hash for them for a month.
Prudie would rather sling hash than be a 37-year-old child.
The final humiliation was finding out that I, as dance director, would be required to sling hash.
